title: Moody's upgrades BOCY covered bonds
content:
Moody's proceeded today to the upgrading of the mortgage covered bonds of Bank of Cyprus to Baa3 from B1. 

According to the credit agency's report, the upgrading follows the amendment of Bank of Cyprus' covered bonds programme documentation. 

It is noted that Moody's also considered two key mitigants against disruption risk following an issuer insolvency. 

Given the significant reduction of refinancing risk in the programme, protections against disruption risk following an issuer insolvency and the issuer's limited discretion, Moody's has decided not to apply the Timely Payment Indicator (TPI) analysis for this programme, which was previously at Very Improbable. 

Prior to this change, the TPI framework constrained the covered bonds'rating at the B1 level.
